website_summaries.verdict: It's great to see more touch-screen Windows 8 laptops under $600, but note that the Asus X202E requires some compromises in performance and battery life.
pros: The Asus Vivobook X202E is very inexpensive for a touch-screen Windows 8 laptop, and looks and feels like a more high-end system
cons: The CPU trades down to a slower model, battery life is unimpressive, and the large touch pad is flaky

website_summaries.verdict: The Asus VivoBook X202E-DH31T budget ultraportable is an affordable alternative to touch ultrabooks, but takes some hits in performance and battery life.
pros: Slim and light with aluminum construction

customer_reviews.title: Complete piece of junk!!!
customer_reviews.text: Complete piece of junk ! We bought this Its been 3 years and we have not been able to use this computer for more than 6 months. After which, every time we start it, it starts updating and after 45 mins, it says not able to update so starts reverting the updates. This keeps on happening the whole day. So logically we have not used this laptop after 6 months. Will never recommend this s*** to any one. The only reason we bought this one was due to good reviews and light weight. Never ever going to buy ASUS products!!!
customer_reviews.author: KUKKSRN

customer_reviews.title: DON'T UPGRADE TO WIN 8.1!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to Win 8.1 and my headphone jack immediately stopped working. After lots of trials and tribulations, trips to the computer repair shop etc., I had to spend an hour on the phone with Asus customer service (who were great - thanks Wayne in Caribbean!) I had to roll back the installation all the way to a reinstall of win 8.0. Had to reinstall all my programs etc. Something wrong with the 8.1 upgrade. I've solved the problem of hating the Win 8 interface by downloading Advanced System Care who offer a "tool" to show the Win 7 start menu - solves my problem.
customer_reviews.author: suzyf921

customer_reviews.title: Subpar
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for about a year. Several months ago the left mouse button started to fail; it double-clicks every time I use it. The machine is still usable, but I have to carry around a portable mouse for it. The touch screen constantly spazzes out and the screen is so small that it's not as functional as you might hope it to be. Windows 8 stinks. It just does. Of course it's not ASUS's fault that Microsoft made a crappy OS. But you're the person using the computer and whose "fault" it is isn't really going to matter when you're using a crappy system. So know it going in.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Johnson

customer_reviews.title: this is the best for your money
customer_reviews.text: I've been dreaming for a Windows touch screen, and this is my dream coming true. To begin with, the Asus x202 is a well-built laptop. It's so beautiful that it's almost a consummated art work. The laptop is light (2.9 lbs.) and with a good price ($549). The touch screen is responsive, Windows 8 run flawlessly, came with a 500 G drive, partitioned into two drives, C: and D:. Office 2007 work beautifully with the touch screen. Another nice feature is that with the I3 Intel third generation processor (Ivy Bridge), there is almost no heat emitted. No matter what program you run, it just get warm, never get hot. I would highly recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne P

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price. Awesome for travel.
customer_reviews.text: Size: AWESOME. I've traveled with this internationally and it's great to carry along through airports. Power: It's good enough for most things. I've done some Photoshop work on it, but it's a bit sluggish at times. It works for normal online use... streaming Netflix, Hulu... Touchscreen works well. Keyboard is a good size and works well mostly. BAD: Ctrl key is junk on mine. I go to copy (Ctrl + c) and the Ctrl key doesn't work half the time. I end up with a "c" in the place of the text I was trying to copy.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Grabowski

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic little rig.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to come across a value like this very often. It's a macbook air sized machine, slightly thicker, but just as quality of build-- metal case, glass touch screen to boot. I was able to upgrade the wireless and put in an SSD with little issue. This is a highly "mod-able" machine that power users often go to for a cheap fast laptop that is quite similar to the ultrabook field, yet has a touch screen and is about 1/2 the price of other options. There is only one downside to this one for me: it's a bit weighty. If you have any particular questions please feel free to add comments.
customer_reviews.author: THATCHMAN1

customer_reviews.title: Good but a Couple of Glitches
customer_reviews.text: This computer works well but it has its problems. I am thinking of returning it. The touchpad does weird things around the edges and I would prefer not to have to be constantly be aware of where I am on it. The wifi connection drops - not all the time but enough to be annoying. I think i saw another review that said its a cheap part. Everything else is just about as advertised. Good speed, good size for travel, good display, good looks in general. I like to quick start thing also. Update Sent it back last week. I could have probably lived with the flaky touchpad but the wifi problem was getting worse.
customer_reviews.author: EdZen

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy customer here. I purchased this laptop from amazon warehouse deals as a 11.6in touchscreen laptop for my sister. when it arrived, THE TOUCHSCREEN DID NOT WORK. The screen looks & feels like it had been replaced (definitely not a capacitive touchscreen - I am a computer tech & know what I'm talking about). Here is what sucks about it the most though. This was 100% amazon's fault for NOT testing the laptop before they sold it as a refurbished "like new" unit. COME ON, the touchscreen should be the FIRST thing you test. I have purchased many things from AWD in the past, but now I will definitely think twice...
customer_reviews.author: Dave Ventresca

customer_reviews.title: Super sensitive everything
customer_reviews.text: First - I hate the new windows. I don't want all their stupid apps. Second - the mousepad and screen are too sensitive, it's super annoying. Third - it will just power off for no reason. Fourth - when it does an update, it doesn't always give you the option to postpone and will just start a countdown. Fifth - the fan started make a loud wheeze a few months in. Sixth - it won't let me change the language out of Spanish. It seems nicely built and I'm sure most of these problems are Window's fault, but this is my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Eden

customer_reviews.title: Great litle PC!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! the perfect size for what I need. I got the pink one by the seller's mistake and I must say it is exactly the color they show on the picture. I would have prefer the black one but the pink is not that shiny and childish. Of course I will get a hard shell case in black for when I am not feeling like having a pink laptop. The PC so far is doing great! I am writing the review from it. Of course I have had it for just 3 days. I love the touchscreen, I do not need a mouse anymore. I think for the price this is the best think you could find!
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Kind of worth the $350
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by how well build this little machine is. ASUS has really nice design aesthetics. However the choice of finish for outside is quite questionable. I had the laptop in a bag with few plastic cables, mouse, pens and books. The metallic outer shell got scratched like crazy. It almost feels like the paint is coming off. The screen quality is ok, the viewing angles are poor, but it's pretty accurate with touch. This is perfect machine for something quick, small, set-up. Much better than other cheap laptops.
customer_reviews.author: volodoscope

customer_reviews.title: Slow and Don't Touch -
customer_reviews.text: It is slow. Not sure if its windows 8 or the hardware or both. Ads come up all the time. If you are hitting a number key and you happen to touch or get near the screen, you are somewhere else and what you think you were typing, you are not. Ads were the most annoying!!! Virus protector, and I don't remember the rest. All the time. Using quicken, you took a rest as the processor worked through your entry. Returned and got a Levono which is faster and does not have the touch screen... and it is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Many Words

customer_reviews.title: Happy Overall
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Asus laptop and again made a good choice again. Tuff little laptop with nice aluminum case. Only complaint is Windows 8 because it needs to have the bugs worked out of it. Fly a lot and found my bigger laptop too much to take onboard and this has worked great. I have an iPad but can't do the things on it that I can with the Asus since I have it tied in to my office computer. I use it mainly for work and not much browsing, and have found the battery to last me five to six or more hours.
customer_reviews.author: Wheeler Canyon Ted

customer_reviews.title: Touch-screen is a nice addition, as is the quick-boot function
customer_reviews.text: Solid little notebook for the price. Touch-screen is a nice addition, as is the quick-boot function. As indicated by other reviewers, battery-life is an issue but if the intent is to use this device for a couple of hours at a time, then it serves its purpose. Wireless connectivity can be a bit fussy at times. Portability is, as expected given its size, excellent. Some may cry foul at the following statement but I personally use my VivoBook more than my IPAD...
customer_reviews.author: Froggy Mojo

customer_reviews.title: Owned for a few months now.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size of this computer for the price. It is a well built and does exactly what I need it to. It is lightweight and pretty much an ultra book. The touchscreen utilizes Windows 8 brilliantly. This platform should only continue to grow in the future. UPDATE: I had to send it in after about 6 months as the HD crashed. Then shortly after I got it back, the screen went black and I can now only use it when I hook it up to a monitor. Not good. Changing from a 4 to a 1/2 point review.
customer_reviews.author: Create58

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: I like my Asus touch screen but if you plug in a usb mouse and then shut it off then pull the mouse before you plug in back in then the touch screen won't work and you have to do a quick repair which is built in and works everytime but it gets annoying.. It's just medium fast but the screen is bright and readable. I also like the smallness and weight of this unit. Overall I think it's good piece.......However, Windows 8 is terrible in my opinion but Office 365 is great....
customer_reviews.author: Cliff P.

customer_reviews.title: A very nice little laptop
customer_reviews.text: Great little laptop all-around - nice form factor, responsive touchscreen, and more than enough for basic computing (web, email, music, movies, basic document processing) without any additional upgrades like SSD or RAM. The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that the screen is just a little dim. In any case, great deal at this price point, and my wife is very happy with it. I'd like to emphasize "basic computing." Don't buy this if you are looking to play high-res games or run any other kinds of heavy jobs - it lacks the necessary resources, and you will need to spend more money.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Dardik

customer_reviews.title: Christmas 2012 gift...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is great. Went to Staples to try it out, but the one they sell does not have bluetooth! Their's was an S202E. This one is the X202E with more features. Sturdy machine and way cool! We love it. Purchased for a gift and it is used daily. Great price, speedy, easy to use right out of the box and convenient for travel. So far it has been fantastic!! Hope it continues....
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop for Student
customer_reviews.text: I use this laptop for school only, and do not run too many programs on it except internet, apps, and word processing. I would recommend this laptop for taking notes during class. The laptop has a program called Reader that allows you to upload PDFs of the classes powerpoints and you can highlight the powerpoints and add notes, and save it really easily for later. I would not recommend this if you need to run hardcore software.
customer_reviews.author: Lester

customer_reviews.title: SUPPORT BAD- -WOULD'T RECOMMEND ITEM
customer_reviews.text: don't know how this laptop really works since it has not worked right since i bought it--has had problems from the beginning--would not recommend this product--it has taken me over a month of conversations and texts to get rma number to send it back--would like my money back-- but thats a laugh they even said i would have to pay for repairs since my warrenty was out of date--at that time warrenty was only 7 months old--had to prove to them by invoice when i bought it and still they are saying i may owe some money--if that happens they THEY CAN KEEP IT!!!--at this stage of the game i don't care Dawn Hosney-NY
customer_reviews.author: DAWN HOSNEY

customer_reviews.title: Not so thrilled...
customer_reviews.text: Liked this computer at first (have had it now for over a year), but it has a problem with shutting off suddenly for no apparent reason. It occurs randomly and getting customer support is proving futile. It didn't occur during the first 30 day, and then only every few weeks or so, but it is annoying and I am concerned with the shutdowns corrupting the OS at some point...
customer_reviews.author: Bill Royal

customer_reviews.title: Purchased new but came with problems?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laptop new, so that I could avoid problems that a used one would have. I'm starting to wonder if purchasing refurbished would have been a better option. I got it new and the 'V' key was already falling off... Other than that, it's average speed, nothing special, Except for the cool touch feature. Sad though that a new laptop comes damaged... Don't have time to return it though, I'm going out of country....
customer_reviews.author: n@han.A

customer_reviews.title: I hate Windows 8
customer_reviews.text: I could not do Windows 8 so I returned it immediately and got a Mac. Touch screen was cool. Could have been a nice machine, I can't say for sure. I grew up on Windows and despise the new interface. I want a computer, not a tablet. Small enough to be a tablet, especially with the touchscreen capabilities. Was nice and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend so I only got to use it for a brief while. I recommended this as a replacement for her old netbook which needed to be retired. I think it's a pretty good device for the price. It's quite lite, sturdy exterior, and start up is fast enough. The condition was brand new, although the box looked like it had been opened already. I did check everything and nothing seemed out of place.
customer_reviews.author: shinwolf

customer_reviews.title: smooth but lacks good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say, the hinge is very sturdy. i expected it to be like the yoga, where once you touch the screen, it would move back, the vivo does not do that. it does what it is meant to do, runs 1080p movies perfectly fine. the only complaint i have is that the speakers really really sucks... if you want to enjoy your media on this laptop (which it's not really meant for) you should look else where or get a set of good speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent laptop with a very nice-sized touchscreen. It is lightweight and thin, and the build quality is admirable, not cheap. It has everything I love about the Ultrabook trend, plus the touchscreen which works so nicely with Windows 8. I think it's underpowered versus true Ultrabooks, but the price is great for a day-to-day workhorse. Other than the not-so-blazing speed, I highly recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: JayInAtlanta

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my lady because she wanted a smaller size laptop. she loves it! she particularly loves the touchscreen, but she does use both the screen and the keyboard. Windows 8 does take some getting use to, but other than that I would highly recommend this product for someone who wants plenty of processing, memory, and compact size. This is the second ASUS product I have purchased, and I have been pleased with them both.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little thing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this recently for my teen, was not really expecting much given the price I paid ($424)...but WOW! Put it this way, I have been using a MacBook pro for the past 4 years, and this thing blows me away. Window 8 is nice with the touch capability this computer has. Size, keyboard, navigation and overall quality are amazing for the price. I am very impressed. Great buy! --Happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Zinnia

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your get what you order
customer_reviews.text: Beware, this is not the x202e. I received the q200 and it has the second gen I3 chip and no Bluetooth. the description clearly says this has Bluetooth and I have told amazon and it is still on the description. It is not a bad computer if you get the correct one. I did order another one from a different amazon market person and it is the correct laptop and it says on it x202e and it has Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: B. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: When I read the reviews it compared this computer to others that are 900. Not a fair comparison. I could hardly find an i3 laptop for a similar price. The screen size is surprisingly suitable. I gave up my i5 laptop for a nexus 7 recently, after months of being laptop free I really am happy with this portable laptop with the power of a much larger computer. My kids love the touchscreen,although I only use it for the Windows 8 start screen.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Braun

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I got this computer yesterday and have been playing with it ever since. I'm not use to Windows 8 but it is easy to get adjusted to it. I love everything about this computer and so far have no complaints. Before this computer I got an Asus with ubuntu and hated it. I returned it. This was 100 dollars more but it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hllaverty

customer_reviews.title: Way better than any pad or tablet
customer_reviews.text: Best of all worlds. Touch screen and full keyboard. You can still play the majority of your favorite apps that are meant for ipad or tablets.My favorite aspect is that it has a hdmi output and usb 3.0. Plays HD Mp4's perfectly without lagging. Plugs right into my 42 inch flat screen and plays as nice as a DVD player. Only flaw is windows 8, DO NOT get this unless your willing to learn a new OS. To put it simply, if your a MAC guy, picture trying to learn PC, or vice versa. Thats the extent to how different Windows 8 is to windows 7.
customer_reviews.author: Mi Hee Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for an ultrabook, especially for the price - its a little bit underspec'd for what i use laptops for - moderate gaming and heavy programming sometimes involving medium sized databases handles very well though... the touchscreen and 2 finger scroll are normally disabled for a few seconds (up to 5 or 10) after taking it off of sleep if it has been on sleep for a long time, but otherise works great
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Blappert

customer_reviews.title: Super Portable
customer_reviews.text: This is a real super portable notebook and affordable over all. Even it's an entry level ultrabook it has cool functions as the touch screen ideal to deal with Windows 8 and pretty nice terminations. I bought it for my mom, she commutes every day and doesn't need a super computer. If you work every day in your office you can connect a USB keyboard for a better experience.
customer_reviews.author: Fede

customer_reviews.title: "Silver" has a pink tone in the lid from most angles.
customer_reviews.text: The computer itself is a perfectly suitable, budget thin & light. Throw an SSD in to overcome the bottleneck created by the 5400rpm 2.5" hdd. My only complaint is that the silver option has an obvious pink tone in the lid. It is not true silver, so beware if you're wanting an actual silver. I noticed it when I pulled it out of the box for the first time, then my friend walked in and mentioned the pink tone without me saying anything. "It's kinda got some pink in it, doesn't it?" That's all I needed to hear to package it right back up and return this for a less feminine color.
customer_reviews.author: Parks Committee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and we'll built laptop (especially compared to the X200 ...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and we'll built laptop (especially compared to the X200 it replaced) has held up to being used daily as my diagnostic and information laptop at the shop under greasy and dirty conditions; then I take it home, wipe it down and plug in the hdmi. Was lacking bluetooth and a SSD. I added an Intel 7260 WiFi card and a 250gb Samsung Evo 840.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Thoma

customer_reviews.title: Tiny machine
customer_reviews.text: The speakers are good for the size of the laptop. It's a good laptop for word processing, internet browsing, and light gaming. The battery life is decent at about 41/2 hours or so. I use it for taking notes during college classes and it is light to tote around. The touch screen is responsive. I would recommend primarily for college or school purposes.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor and indifferent service support
customer_reviews.text: This laptop was a present for my daughter after a while, the glass had a crack. My daughter sent it to ASUS for repair more than a month ago and have had great difficult coordinating for the repair because the repair center does not have a telephone, but a chat and email system. They keep asking for paperwork and reporting that the equipment is sitting in the shop in the meantime. Will never again will buy from ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Rod35

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Forgetting the fact that Windows 8 is a steaming pile, the hardware is actually really nice. I installed ubuntu on it, and I can say that without doing any tricks such as dimming the screen, turning off any wifi or the like, I can easily get 6+ hours of runtime out of this machine. It is comfortable to use. I like the touch screen, though it's mostly a novelty item, as there isn't really much use for it.
customer_reviews.author: bandi13

customer_reviews.title: Love this little laptop!!
customer_reviews.text: At this price, it's impossible to beat this little laptop!! It has the same qualities of any other 11.6" ultrabook... and by "Quality" I mean the overall performance, materials and aesthetics. They are great!! It has Everything I was looking for!! IMHO, this is a terrific system, especially for the price. If you want a sleek, modern Windows system you can't go wrong with this one. The 11.6" screen doesn't feel small in the least, and I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy M.

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent mini-computer, very light weight, working well so for, which is over six months. Not so very fast, but adequate. I'm happy with it, and if it lasts more than 2 or 3 years, would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Assoc For Natural Psych

customer_reviews.title: This is how Windows 8 was ment to be used
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for school and has been great. Bought 3 weeks ago and the only problem I have had was not getting distracted by all the extras and games and focusing on my school work. Battery lasts about 4 hours with heavy use. I have seen many people complaining about windows 8 and I can only assume that they were not using a touch screen. I actually like Windows 8 but could understand someone not liking it if they had to use a mouse to perform some of the functions like scrolling through the start menu.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pierce

customer_reviews.title: VivoBook X202E
customer_reviews.text: I am a secondary teacher, so what I mainly needed out of a computer was portability. It's size and light weight are perfect for me. I don't need computational muscle; all I use are Microsoft office programs, and listen to music or stream movies. For me, this computer is perfect. I do notice the lack of strength though; my desktop instantly starts Microsoft Office programs, but this one takes about 10-20 seconds to open. A pleasant surprise was how handy the touch screen really is. Right in class I can zoom into pictures and slide from picture to picture. It's fun!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: great portability and durability
customer_reviews.text: Great little laptop. I have traveled with this laptop backpacking around the world. I've had it for four years and it still works great! I never liked windows 8, but that's not the laptop's fault.
customer_reviews.author: logotico

customer_reviews.title: Impressive hardware but really slow
customer_reviews.text: For the price I would say it is quite impressive. Hardware is neat and works very well. But it is a really slow machine. I have never used a computer this slow before. Is it because it is an i3? I was not expecting a superfast computer but it really takes forever for any little application to start up on this machine. I will definitely have to change it soon. I actually got a Q200e so I don't know if an X202e is any better
customer_reviews.author: EN

customer_reviews.title: ASUS VivoBook - 11.6"
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little notebook. The design is attractive and it functions flawlessly. The only drawback is that the keyboard is not backlit, but I knew that before purchasing it. The price was great and the build quality is on par with much more expensive machines. ASUS is now my first choice for any laptop needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop I've ever had for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this four years ago and it's still running!!! Best laptop I've ever had for the price. Can run photo shop at full tilt and played black desert online recently I was proud of the little thing haha :)
customer_reviews.author: ABeck

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Great computer for the price. Touch screen is a must for windows 8. I am, however, having trouble with getting the wifi to work reliably. If I could figure that out, it would be four stars. The fifth star would be filled in if the battery lasted just a little bit longer, but it does not last as long as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Nino Brown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent functionality for a durable product at an excellent price point
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous! Have had product now for 2 years and has performed flawlessly. Use it often for client PPT presentations and have carried it around the world. Light, portable, and extremely functional at an incredibly economical price. Love the touch screen. Have no criticism!
customer_reviews.author: USA Architect

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Laptop
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent laptop. The construction is sturdy and it is very responsive. I immediately updated the BIOS so I haven't experienced any of the fan noise problems mentioned in previous reviews. I replaced the HDD with an SSD. The process is a bit more complicated than a typical laptop but anyone should be able to do it. Just do a quick Google search for a step-by-step guide to show you how. It's unfortunate that the RAM can't be upgraded nor the battery replaced, but my last ultralight lasted 3 years without either of those two components being replaced/upgraded.
customer_reviews.author: lll Ragnarok lll

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight of the PC. Has all the features of a full PC. Battery life isn't great and the top is very thin. I already dented it but I assume that's one of the ways they reduced the weight. Books quickly. Windows 8 is a touch slow but not bad. Good bargain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CareBear

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my old notebook
customer_reviews.text: Amazon The shipping was fast, I love my notebook I 'm glad my notebook crashed because I would have been stuck in the past With my old notebook. the price was great an u did not take advantage of the product markup keeping cost reasonable. thank u.
customer_reviews.author: mary m

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I actually meant to click on the Samsung and bought this one inadvertently. Works great for my purposes. I hate Windows 8, but it does work well on this device. The touchpad is sometimes a bit too sensitive and can pick up fingers and hands moving nearby.
customer_reviews.author: dhoelzer

customer_reviews.title: Solid laptop!
customer_reviews.text: - The build is solid and looks sleek - The touchscreen brings the best out of Windows 8 - Charges fast but empties somewhat quickly as well - Would recommend to anyone who needs a PC but loves tablets and smartphones
customer_reviews.author: pjmazza419

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my EEPC I got several years ago. I love it, ASUS is an awesome company. I highly recommend this product. For the price and features of a touch laptop running Windows 8 it is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Edward O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: WiFi connectivity problems
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled with WiFi connectivity problems with this laptop that have only increased over time. It has been frustrating and inconvenient, to say the least. Did I get a defective laptop? Probably. In the beginning it wasn't bad enough to be a real problem, but by six months I was often losing connection and unable to connect again. I would not purchase this laptop again, nor would I recommend others do so either. It's unfortunate because I have purchased ASUS before and had enjoyed those products.
customer_reviews.author: Jorie Wehrell

customer_reviews.title: Poor. Style and functionality(slim/light) - was 5 of 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, purchased in 2012, lasted maybe 17 months before something mechanically malfunctioned. Didn't drop, spill, or environmentally impact this product and it morphed into a paperweight just through normal schoolwork use. Poor. Style and functionality(slim/light) - was 5 of 5 stars. Of course fast forward 3-4 years, I'm sure there's better.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Kao

customer_reviews.title: Gave it a go...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like it... I have two of them in my house and both are worthless. The first issue was the wifi connectivity. It would drop costantly and wound need to be reset to reconnect. Then the hard rive seemed to slow down. Now both refuse to install windows 8.1. Group all of this together with a laughably poor touch screen and you get hot garbage... toots!!
customer_reviews.author: Billiam

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on 2012 for my college, but after 6 months some keys in the keyboard stopped working. I've looked for a solution in many websites including the Asus website. Unfortunately I ended up with a broken laptop. I would never consider buying an Asus product.
customer_reviews.author: C.R

customer_reviews.title: This Meets My Expecations
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time reviewing available smaller laptops online mostly on Amazon and choose the ASUS VivoBook and have not been disappointed. I removed from the shipping box, charged the battery and started to use without one problem. It is now over month and I continue to have trouble free usage and as I travel it is used in many different environments without missing a beat. I thought at first small screen size would be an hindrance (price you pay for having book or tablet) but have gotten use to it and the convince of unit more then makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product
customer_reviews.text: It is melting and the keyboard has a wave in the middle, won't stay on. I wish I would have remembered to complain earlier, life was hectic as I was leaving the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible internet connection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this computer because of the small size. For some reason, my internet connection shows limited even though I have multiple devices such as laptops, kindle, and roku that have no problems with internet at all. When I have contacted Asus customer service, they know less about computers than I do. They were unable to solve my problem and I am really disappointed. Think twice about a laptop that has internet no better than a cellphone.
customer_reviews.author: An online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Service by ASUS
customer_reviews.text: Great little laptop for my daughter. About 2 weeks after she got it...she dropped it! Even in its case it received extensive damage to the screen because it fell on the corner. ASUS has an accidental insurance on this computer. You have to get it from Amazon and not other retailers. 2 weeks door to door and the screen replaced...not hassle, no questions. I have since bought 2 more ASUS products.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2two

customer_reviews.title: Great value for touch laptop
customer_reviews.text: I will never go back to a non-touch laptop. This machine is awesome and the price makes it all the better. The whole experience with Asus was just like it should be with a new computer. They're doing some awesome work in the PC space. From the moment of unboxing to the set up, it was a breeze. I had this machine going in no time. The touch performance is excellent. Looking at the machine, I would expect it to cost much more. I would highly recommend this machine to anyone who wants to get a touch laptop even those who may be looking for a high-end machine. This device fits the bill for many needs and budgets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, with a little set-up required
customer_reviews.text: The form factor is great, and Windows 8 is very fluid with a touchscreen device like this. However, by default the touchpad does not have smart gestures enabled. I had to go download the driver for that from the ASUS site, and it wasn't the most intuitive process. My other big complaint is that the 1/8" jack functions as both headphone output and microphone input, so you have to jump to the desktop and select which you want every time you plug your headphones in. It's actually a pretty big annoyance, and I can't find a way to set headphones as default. All in all though, it's a great little casual computing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Doug K

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is amazing! Boots up in 10 seconds even without a SSD. very responsive touch screen and I love windows 8! The metro look takes a little to get use too but it's simply awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little laptop. I love the size, but it seems to have some trouble consistently connecting to the internet. I don't recall having the same problem with the other version of this laptop I had previously.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: My favorite computer now !
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this laptop. Perfect portable size and does MUCH more than our iPad for a fraction of the cost of a comparable machine. This has a full size keyboard and a touch screen too. If you don't like W8, install classic start and it will act like W7. HDMI works great and we use this hooked up to the TV for watching videos. Nice performance and style. Have not had a single problem with it. WiFi does disconnect sometimes, but I'm not sure if it's the computer or the router. Our iPad disconnects too, so I think it's the router or modem. Will update the review if I find out it's the ASUS....
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This Windows 8 PC was perfect for all of my needs. The i3 processor is no problem for me and the touchscreen is a great feature. I'm even able to do some light gaming, other than simple tasks such as web browsing or writing documents. My only problem is with Internet Explorer, which came pre-installed. This, however, can be easily resolved by downloading a different browser. Overall, this is a great machine for people looking to do the basics on a PC. The price makes it definitely worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good for apps, games, Internet but not for work
customer_reviews.text: Great size for on the go & very helpful for learning Windows 8. Keyboard is a good size & fits fingers well. Would have been better if Microsoft Office had come installed on it.
customer_reviews.author: amc

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Bad Operating System!
customer_reviews.text: If it was not for windows I give this unit 5 stars, its not Asus fault but windows is just too much hassle- The product has a great fit and finish and solid as a rock otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Toasterize!

customer_reviews.title: Great little laptop
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is exactly what I've been looking for in terms of price, specs, and form factor. The fact that it was a touch-screen made it even better. The i3 is slightly under-powered without HT, but it does just fine for my purposes of mostly surfing, listening to music, and writing. I'll eventually upgrade to an SSD, but for my purposes, it hasn't been necessary yet.
customer_reviews.author: Alcide Ford Jr

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Very good Little computer, considering that my other computer is a laptop with 17". but this ASUS VIVO Book has a keyboard that adujust to my typing very good. I am still learning Windows 8 so I can not give more detais as to how does it compair with my HP 17". I may come back in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little laptop.It was delivered in the earlier part of the time frame and I had to have FedEx hold it for me. I find I use the touchscreen more than I thought I would.
customer_reviews.author: Kevinnovator

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS COMPUTER
customer_reviews.text: The only con is that he doesnt have a CD drive but for me thats actually better since this makes the computer both lighter and sleeker looking. Runs perfectly. Although I have heard many bad things about windows 8 I actually enjoy it. So that worked for me too. I love this computer since I take it to school to write notes on it and its exactly what I needed and wanted out of a computer VERY light, fast, and lots of memory.
customer_reviews.author: Snaha Sanghvi

customer_reviews.title: Great notebook
customer_reviews.text: I love this Vivobook ... Its compact and light weight and build quality is not cheap and still feels sturdy enough ... The touchscreen works great ... Also with i3 and only 4 gigs of ram, this is faster enough for most of our daily works and browsing ... I would have given a 5 star if this little one didn't had the headphone problems and if the screen would have a low glare ... Somehow, the sound doesn't work if i plug the headphones into this ...
customer_reviews.author: Kanthi

customer_reviews.title: Great PC
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my 10 year old daughter. She loves it. the touch screen works well. The computer seems well made. It is fast with Windows 8.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCluskey

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS LAPTOP! I've had it for about a year now and I don't have any real issues with it. It's a great product! I love the touchscreen and how light it is! It's great for travel and college-life!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: The computer once it comes on is fine. I bought two at the same time and my wifes is fine. Mine will not start up. It can take up to 20 minutes before it boots up. Almost a bigger concern is Asus has had almost two months to respond to my requests for assistance and they dont. It looks like I will be needing a new laptop soon and it will never be Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: worked out of the box perfectly. Just confusing that since Google stopped working with MS and checking the box to sync your google calendar with the email throws the whole thing off. But that is not their fault
customer_reviews.author: Zave C. Rudman

customer_reviews.title: love this laptop
customer_reviews.text: it is an awesome laptop i use it more than 15 hours a day perfect for everything the only draw back in the battery life
customer_reviews.author: azharuddinkhan

customer_reviews.title: Great compact computer!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this and couldnt be happier! But and there is always a but. The trac pad is awful! Just doesnt work how I would hope, but I just baught a wireless mouse that should take care of the issue. The compute itself is made very well, good design and overall great performance! Touch screen works like a charm!!
customer_reviews.author: tv

customer_reviews.title: asus
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought me an Asus as a replacement for an iMac. A few months later, we bought one for him and then one for our daughter in high school. Windows 8 took a little getting used to but now we love it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Capps Oeters

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, could have been better
customer_reviews.text: I use it primarily for work. I don't like big heavy laptop, so I really love light weight of Asus Vivobook 1) Touch screen is sensitive (compared to my previous laptop HP Touchsmart TM2). It would be great to have a pen input same as my Touchsmart 2) Experienced lags when I opened more than 10 tabs in Google Chrome and several word/excel and pdf documents 3) It would be great to have option to change battery for longer usage
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for years now and have been able to update all the way up to Win10
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Stuck on BIOS page after 3days
customer_reviews.text: I loved it, small and light, fit in my and (big) bag. Windows 8 takes some learning but the touch screen made it pretty easy. Screen was a bit small through. but you have zoom. However, on the evening of the 3rd day of use it went to the BIOS page and refused to move despite tech support intervention. Asus gave me the offer of fixing it but review from others with tech problems made me skeptical. So i went with reliable Amazon. I got my money back so quick. the laptop had not even reach them yet. Love the customer service. Bought something new already. HP Envy Touch Screen Ultrabook.
customer_reviews.author: Kai Raine

customer_reviews.title: keyboard and mouse VERY poor
customer_reviews.text: Hate Windows 8! Asus VivoBook good, except I have to use a wireless keyboard and mouse. The entire area below the keyboard is touch sensitive and will destroy what you've typed. Because this is connect to the mouse, makes use of the touch pad unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Disciple

customer_reviews.title: Utilitarian
customer_reviews.text: Good for what it was intended. Very useful (for me) due to size. Enjoy being able to carry it rather than "lug" it.
customer_reviews.author: K. H. Jones

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: My daughter really likes the touch screen. Office 8 is taking some time to get used to, but the machine itself works well. Easy to type on, boots up nicely, no restarts as of yet (owned it about 3 weeks to a month now).
customer_reviews.author: Nay

customer_reviews.title: Item function very good, Price is good
customer_reviews.text: Item exactly with description, delivery on time, Item function very good, Price is good, too. recommended seller.
customer_reviews.author: Ha Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Specs are amazing for the price, I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to buy a nice small laptop for a very decent price
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift For Students
customer_reviews.text: This product is light weight with a high capacity of memory. The touch screen is smooth and corresponds well with Windows 8. Pages load quickly and the feature for apps has been a great advantage. I highly recommend this product for college students as I am a college student myself and find its portability and memory impeccable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ASUS VIVOBOOK
customer_reviews.text: Very nice laptop. Small but with nice sized keyboard. Touch screen works well. I like its portability and the fact that for such a compact machine it has a decent amount of memory. This is a modern, economical laptop which is good for word processing and works nicely with Windows 8.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So this is what Windows 8 can do!
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. It weighs almost nothing. It will do everything my Lenovo I-7 can do except load multiple VM's. the touch screen really shows off the power of windows 8. Everything seems to work easier. I was able to quickly add 5 email accounts to the active start screen email and they all worked, despite the complex security on some of them. I use it now for morning coffee and computer and later it serves as my Netflix movie server. Nice little laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Passalacqua

customer_reviews.title: good material, terrible software
customer_reviews.text: I had an asus notebook before, so I choosed the same this time. Love it. But please may I have my old, good working Windows XP on it? W 8 is really fancy, but functionally is a fatal error. :-(
customer_reviews.author: bandita

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great little notebook for the money. Too many updates that makes things no longer work, like the printer drivers
customer_reviews.author: Wingman

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Best deal i ever made!, great and powerfull laptop, very thin also; it just weights around 1.3 kilos, i recomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tekorei-PY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: After 5 years, this little baby is still kicking butt. Swap out the HDD for a SSD though!
customer_reviews.author: Fugare

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laptop to upgrade from an aging HP Tx2000. I have a ton of applications, including AutoCad, Simul8, CorelDraw, etc. The new laptop arrived five days ago. So far everything going exceptionally well. All apps have uploaded in Windows 8, The laptop is responsive. Other review criticize the battery life. I have not tested this yet, but I can live with a 4 hour battery. Exceptional value so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and highly portable
customer_reviews.text: I considered an Ipad and Ipad mini but with no flash capability (web browsing) they did not meet all my needs. I also looked at other tablets and ultrabooks. This is close to a tablet but with a full Windows 8 OS for all my apps and a keyboard you can use professionally. I can handle it with one hand and it's light and easy to tuck away. The only thing it's missing is a lighted keyboard. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Keith

product_meta.title: ASUS X202E-DH31T Laptop (Windows 8, Intel Core i3-3217U 1.8 GHz Processor, 11.6" LED Touchscreen Display, SSD: 500 GB, RAM: 4 GB DDR3) Black [OLD VERSION]
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackCore i3 3217U / 1.8 GHz - Windows 8 64-bit - 4 GB RAM - 500 GB HDD - 11.6" touchscreen wide 1366 x 768 / HD - Intel HD Graphics 4000 - aluminum gray
